root.para: On January 1, 20X1, JLM issued a 5-year, $1 million, BB-rated bond obligation. The interest rate on the bond obligation was fixed at 8%, payable on a quarterly basis. On February 1, 20X1, to hedge its exposure to changes in LIBOR (that is, the designated benchmark interest rate risk being hedged), JLM entered into a 5-year interest rate swap with a notional amount of $1 million to receive a fixed rate of 8% and pay a variable rate equal to 90-day LIBOR (at the end of each quarter) plus 2%, payable on a quarterly basis, with the first payment due March 31, 20X1.
